sub_topic: Identifying the cut vertices and bridges in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the undirected graph G shown below. 

```
     1 -- 2 -- 3
    /          |
   4 -- 5      |
   |    /      |
   |   /       |
   6 -- 7 -----8
```

a) Identify the cut vertices and bridges of the graph G.

b) Suppose we want to add a new edge between vertices 7 and 9, in which case the graph becomes connected. Identify the new cut vertices and bridges of the updated graph.
message_2:
a) In the given graph G, a cut vertex is a vertex whose removal (along with its incident edges) would increase the number of connected components in the graph. Similarly, a bridge is an edge whose removal would increase the number of connected components in the graph.

Cut vertices: {2, 4, 7}
Bridges: {(1, 2), (2, 3), (4, 5)}

b) If we add a new edge between vertices 7 and 9, the graph becomes:

```
     1 -- 2 -- 3
    /          |
   4 -- 5      |
   |    /      |
   |   /       |
   6 -- 7 -----8
        \
         9
```

Now, let's identify the new cut vertices and bridges of the updated graph:

Cut vertices: {2, 7}
Bridges: {(1, 2), (2, 3), (7, 9)}

By adding the new edge between vertices 7 and 9, vertex 4 is no longer a cut vertex, and the bridge (4, 5) is no longer a bridge.
